title: GAD-7 vs DUDIT

date: 2024-12-21
---

## GAD-7 vs DUDIT

Harmony is a versatile tool that allows psychologists and social scientists to harmonise and compare different questionnaires. When studying the differences and similarities between the Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and the Drug Use Disorders Identification Test (DUDIT), Harmony is your go-to tool. GAD-7 vs DUDIT, while seemingly different, may have similarities in the questions posed or the symptoms assessed, and these commonalities can be unearthed with the use of Harmony. This software uses advanced natural language processing and generative AI models, comparing the questions or items in the GAD-7 and DUDIT accurately and efficiently. By calculating a percentage match between the items of the two instruments, GAD-7 vs DUDIT comparison is particularly simple. Researchers can drag and drop their own instruments into Harmony's web interface or choose from the existing database. The ability to compare items across multiple languages only enhances the software's universal appeal. With GAD-7 focusing on generalized anxiety disorder symptoms and DUDIT focusing on drug use disorders, GAD-7 vs DUDIT comparison sheds light on potential overlaps or unique insights between anxiety and substance use disorder. Harmony, with its simple interface and sophisticated technology, can make the GAD-7 vs DUDIT comparative study a straightforward, objective, and informative process. It brings about a new level of ease to harmonisation, allowing researchers to spend more time on analysis and less on manual questionnaire matching.

## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
